original_text:
In early 2017 I started a personal research on Remote Access Trojans (RATs). The goal of the research is to discover possible trends, similarities and other hidden aspects among RATs observed during the last 30 years.

For this purpose I divided the research in several stages. The goal of the first stage is to create a timeline of RATs with all the existing families in the last 30 years. In order to achieve this goal, I am following an iterative methodology:

For every RAT collect all meaningful blogs and reports about it.

Document the resources found.

Find the first mention of the RAT and determine a possible year of appearance.

Check the resources for other possible RAT names.

Repeat.

Because there is a huge lack of formal research on this area, I decided to create small iterations of my timeline and make it public in order to receive early feedback from peers. In this way, I could get assistance, suggestions and corrections in the early stage of my research that will ensure bigger chances of success for next stages of the research.

A Study of RATs: First Timeline Iteration

The first timeline iteration was made public on Jan 22, 2017. This initial version covered 19 years and 85 RATs.
rewritten_text:
The air hung thick with the stench of desperation, a suffocating shroud over the desolate landscape of the internet. In early 2017, the crimson flag of research flapped defiantly, a beacon in the encroaching darkness. My hunger for knowledge gnawed at me, a raven circling the carcass of knowledge I sought.

The first stage of my odyssey was to paint a portrait of the beasts, to map the sprawling landscape of RATs that had slithered through the digital undergrowth over the past 30 years. Each RAT, a phantom in the digital ether, whispered secrets of its origins and deeds, a cryptic riddle waiting to be deciphered.

I began my pilgrimage through the digital ruins, a lone pilgrim traversing a desolate wasteland of forgotten forums and abandoned repositories. Each blog post, each news report, was a testament to the relentless pursuit of knowledge, a beacon burning in the encroaching darkness.

I scoured the depths of the web, tracing the threads of each RAT's journey. I followed the whispers of the forums, the echoes of the news, the whispers of the malware itself. Each new discovery was a fresh scar on the tattered map of the RATs, a testament to the relentless pursuit of knowledge.

Hi backers and website pre-order customers!

Great news to report! Sideclick has arrived in the US and you will receive your order soon!!

Our 8 pallets have made their way through customs and will be departing via railway headed to our fulfillment partner in the next few day.

The products are estimated to arrive at the fulfillment center by Monday, April 25th. Once the shipment is received by the fulfillment company, they will start shipping to customers. You should all receive an email shipping confirmation with tracking #‚Äôs by Friday, April 29th!

We just launched a new website and our goal is to build a robust Help Center featuring many video tutorials and FAQ‚Äôs. We look forward to your feedback as you receive your Sideclicks and start using them. We will welcome any feedback at info@sideclickremotes.com. You all will help us immensely in building out the support section of the website and making sure we have answers to all questions which may arise.

Important Note for ROKU users. There are 4 Adapter Clips that you will receive in your Sideclick Starter Kit for Roku. Please note that when you open your box, there will be an inner tray that holds the Sideclick universal remote and 2 Adapter Clips. You have to take out the inner tray to find the 2 additional Adapter Clips in the lower tray underneath the top tray. We realized that we really should have had some sort of message in the box indicating the location of the bottom tray. Just don‚Äôt throw away the box without taking out all 4 adapter clips!!! You‚Äôll want to hang onto those clips should you change Roku‚Äôs in the future. Roku is constantly cycling through remote styles.

Also, please note that if you ordered anything extra other than a complete starter kit (example, a koozie or a separate adapter clip set), those items will come shipped in a separate package. You will receive your complete Sideclick Starter Kits first and then the extra items about week later.

Thank you so much again for your support, backers!

We‚Äôll send an update again in about 10 days once items start shipping to you!

The Sideclick Team

original_text:
By MARK STEVENSON, Associated Press

MEXICO CITY (AP) ‚Äî A civil defense official says a private mine in northern Mexico did not immediately report a massive acid spill, allowing it to flow into a river that supplies water to tens of thousands of people.

Carlos Arias, director of civil defense for the northern state of Sonora, said the spill at a copper mine near the U.S. border was caused by defects in newly constructed leaching or holding ponds.

Such ponds hold the overflow of acids used to leach metal out of crushed rock. But Arias said a pipe either blew out or became unseated on Aug. 7, allowing about 10 million gallons (40,000 cubic meters) of mining acids to flow downstream into a river.

"Definitely ... it was an error" in the design or construction of the retaining pond, Arias said.

He said the sulfuric acid spill was detected by residents downstream the next day, and that the mine operators hadn't notified state authorities.

Arias said tests have revealed the spill contains pollutants like arsenic above acceptable levels. Water supplies from the river have been cut off to about 20,000 people.

The Grupo Mexico company operates the Buenavista mine in Cananea, Sonora. The company did not respond to requests for comment on Tuesday.

Arturo Rodriguez, the head of industrial inspection for the Attorney General for Environmental Protection, said the mine did advise his agency almost a day after the spill, just within the 24-hour time limit for filing such reports.

He said lax supervision at the mine, along with rains and construction defects, appeared to have caused the spill. Rodriguez said mine operators should have been able to detect the leak before such a large quantity leaked into the river.

Authorities are trying to de-acidify the water in the Bacanuchi and Sonora rivers by adding calcium, Arias said. "What you can't get rid of are the heavy metals," he noted.

The mine, a skeletal monument to human greed, had been caught in a web of its own making. The villagers, huddled in terror, watched as the river choked to death, their water supply poisoned beyond measure. The air grew thick with the acrid stench of sulfur, a symphony of death that sent shivers down their spines.

The mine operators, shrouded in an aura of callous indifference, remained silent witnesses to the unfolding tragedy. Their negligence, as evident by the gaping hole in the retaining pond, was a testament to the recklessness that lurked beneath the surface.

As the sun dipped below the horizon, casting long, grotesque shadows across the ravaged landscape, the true horror of the situation dawned upon the villagers. original_text:
Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Naughty puppy Zeus bit off more than he could chew when he sank his teeth into a can of deodorant ... and BLEW UP the house.

The loveable rogue pierced the tin as he rolled it around the floor but soon got bored and left it next to the gas fire.

It exploded minutes later when the back boiler came on, shattering the double-glazed windows in the living room, blowing out the floorboards and setting fire to the settee.

The total cost of the damage is thought to be around ¬£2,000.

The first owner Kerry Leech, 20, and partner Mathew Heckler, 22, knew about the drama was when they received a text saying their home had blown up.

They returned to find two fire engines with blue lights flashing and and two teams of firefighters trying to deal with the flames.

Kerry said: ‚ÄúWe were out in the car when we received texts saying our house had been blown up, then we were told the living room window had blown out.

‚ÄúI was panicking about our pets and rushed back. We saw flashing lights, two fire engines were outside the house and the street was blocked off.

‚ÄúWe thought someone had put something through the letter-box or there had been a gas explosion.‚Äù

Luckily Zeus, a six-month-old whippet cross, Sonic, a two-year-old whippet, and Vinnie, a 15-month-old greyhound cross escaped the blast along with the couple‚Äôs three cats from the home in Goldthorpe, South Yorkshire.

Added Kerry: ‚ÄúZeus is not in the doghouse for what he had done. He‚Äôs just a pup and at the moment he‚Äôll chew anything.‚Äù

Firefighters told her the most likely cause of the explosion was leaking gas from the can of Lynx deodorant - a Christmas present to Mathew from Kerry‚Äôs parents - that the puppy had been playing with.

It ignited when the back boiler came on to for the central heating.

Mathew said: ‚ÄúThe explosion completely smashed out our bay window, cracked the fireplace, destroyed the floorboards and the sofa is completely ruined. We have had to buy a new one.‚Äù

original_text:
SHANGHAI (Reuters) - China will send inspection teams to eight more provinces and regions to see how well they are complying with state environment rules and fighting the country‚Äôs war on pollution, the environment ministry said.

Residential and business buildings are seen amid thick haze in Kunming, Yunnan province January 18, 2015. REUTERS/Stringer

Beijing has identified local governments as one of the key battlegrounds in its nationwide anti-pollution efforts, with many accused of turning a blind eye to environmental violations in a bid to protect valuable sources of revenue and jobs.

The latest round of inspections will cover the huge coal-producing regions such as Inner Mongolia and Ningxia in the northwest, the old northeastern industrial heartland of Heilongjiang and the poor rural regions of Yunnan and Guangxi in the southwest.

Earlier this year, the Ministry of Environmental Protection (MEP) was given additional powers to send inspection teams anywhere in the country and demand meetings with senior local officials as part of its efforts to root out polluters. It was only the second Chinese agency to be granted such authority.

‚ÄúWe talk about local government interference in environmental enforcement and these central government investigations can address this problem at the source,‚Äù said Ma Jun, director of the Institute of Public and Environmental Affairs, which campaigns on pollution issues in China.

At the end of last year, the government launched a two-month probe of northern Hebei province, one of the country‚Äôs most polluted regions, and found that firms had engaged in ‚Äúfraudulent activities‚Äù and were flouting orders not to expand industrial capacity.

In a separate notice, the environment ministry said on Friday that it had fined several state-owned polluters in May for exceeding emission limits. A subsidiary of oil giant PetroChina Co Ltd in the northeastern city of Dalian was fined a total of 2.9 million yuan ($433,644), it said.

The ministry said it had strengthened the way it enforces its rules in a number of regions, and total fines had reached more than 45.3 million yuan in May alone. A total of 230 plants were ordered to stop production over the period.

‚ÄúWe need to recognize the progress made and this is definitely higher than before, but on the other hand, it is still not enough, and is still cheaper than the cost of compliance,‚Äù Ma said.

‚ÄúWe also don‚Äôt know if in reality the fine will be paid. Many of them are the darlings of local government, which gives them protection,‚Äù he said.

($1 = 6.6875 Chinese yuan)

‚ÄúDo you think Pence will be better than Trump if he were impeached? asked Behar.

"No," replied Waters. "And when we finish with Trump we have to go and get Putin. He‚Äôs next.‚Äù

‚ÄúPutin or Pence?‚Äù Behar asked.

‚ÄúUh, Pence," Waters said.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôll get two for one, with Trump and Putin, then we got to go after Pence," Behar declared.

Waters also said during the interview that she wasn't concerned with illegal leaks made to the press, saying she was grateful for a recent leak of phone conversations between the president and foreign leaders.

Joy Behar, a viper in a viper's nest, sat perched on her perch, her eyes burning with a feral hunger for power. Across from her, Maxine Waters, a viper in a viper's den, mirrored her gaze, her voice a low hiss in the wind.

"Do you think Pence will be better than Trump if he were impeached?" Behar's voice, a rasping whisper in the cacophony, cut through the sterile chatter like a knife.

"No," Waters hissed, her voice echoing the chilling pronouncements of a madman. "And when we finish with Trump, we have to go and get Putin. He's next."

The studio pulsed with a morbid energy, the air thick with the unspoken threat of a thousand missiles. Behar's eyes, cold and calculating, flickered with a predatory gleam.

"Putin or Pence?" she rasped, her voice laced with a chilling indifference.

"Uh, Pence," Waters stammered, her voice barely a whisper in the suffocating silence.

original_text:
About

Server Tycoon is a Construction and Management Simulation (CMS) video game where players have to manage a data center and strive earning game coins offering internet services to their customers

But remember pirates and competitors will try to stop you with frequent cyber attacks so, improve your infrastructure, organise your defences and try to climb the top of the hi¬≠tech finance!

PLATFORMS

Desktop (Win/Mac/GNU Linux)

Mobile (iOS/Android)

FEATURES

Hardware and Software purchasing and management

Cyber Attack and Defence system

Cryptocurrency

Network Management

Disaster (flooding/cooling and power failures, network down, etc.)

HVAC management (heat emission/anti fire/air conditioning)

Business continuity systems

Green computing

Other features collected from backers' feedback

UI/UX

Isometric Voxel Graphics (with camera orbit/pan/zoom)

Augmented Reality (for Mobile only)

DESCRIPTION

Starter Kit

We give you all you need to start earning game coins with your virtual company:

your company building in one random street of The Valley;

one basic cluster (a powerful system made of smaller computers);

an initial budget of coins you can spend buying new clusters;

one employee capable of making your servers working.

The Server

The Server is the main actor of the game's scene. You can buy custom components to assemble a powerful machine capable to gain coins at high speed and resist cyber attacks in time

Service + Time = Coins

When you setup a server and turn it on it offers services on internet. This generates coins that are kept into the server itself until you move them into your Vault

If an attack succeed all the coins contained into a cluster could be stolen!

The Vault

The Vault is a special computer aimed to host your coins and keep them safe from most common cyber attacks

Upgrade it to store even more coins and resist to newest attacks techniques

In this game, coins are not transfered from people (your customers) to service providers (you) through banking institutes. They are a Cryptocurrency that are generated directly into the clusters that offer a service

In other words coins are special files that can physically travel via internet, and that's the reason why cyber pirates want to attack you all the time...

The best defence is a good offense

As previously mentioned, pirates will pass their time attacking you, but as soon as they do it, something will remain on your cluster:

the footprint (the network address) - if the stolen coins have been already moved in the attacking cluster you can try a rescue, or even just revenge... next time he will remember of you ;)

(the network address) - the script used for the attack - use it to understand what was wrong with your defence script, why this is more efficient than yours and learn new defence techniques

- a temporary protection against further attacks coming from that address - your firewall will automatically blacklist attacking address for a short period, restore your cluster before this basic protection expires!

Attacks and defenses are both based on scripts made of few instructions you can learn in minutes, at the time of game's release a free tutorial will teach you the basics of this art. In the meantime, two starting scripts will be included in your firewall

Your Staff

After hiring the best staff from the Employment Agency, send them to IT Trainings to improve their skills and be able to reduce technical interventions

Old stuff matters!

Collecting vintage computers will increase your company capital helping you to set an higher initial price for the shares you are going to sell

Weekly MODs

Accumulate credits to unlock our weekly issues to receive tons of aesthetic MODs

DOWNLOAD

Download for free the Tech Preview (Win, Mac, GNU/Linux) here

HERITAGE

All the features proposed in the past campaign will be included, sooner or later, in Server Tycoon

MODs

Use our weekly MODs to make your server rooms unique!

Thank you for taking the time to check out our project. We truly appreciate it! If you'd like to get involved, any amount helps - head back up to the top of the page, and look for the big green 'Back This Project' button on the right-hand side.

THE TEAM

original_text:
For the next 10 days, Apple will send proceeds from 27 popular apps in the App Store to the World Wildlife Fund (WWF) as part of what it's calling "Apps for Earth." The list includes mobile games like Angry Birds 2 and SimCity BuildIt, camera app VSCO, and messaging service Line. Some apps on the list are free, so Apple says the WWF will also receive proceeds from in-app purchases as well.

The environmental initiative builds on the iPhone maker's commitment to causes like climate change and conservation. CEO Tim Cook has become more vocal about those issues and other social and policy causes over the past few years as he's taken on a more outspoken advocacy role as chief executive.

For instance, Cook gave time during the company's March product reveal to Apple's Lisa Jackson, the former EPA director and now the company's vice president of environment, policy, and social initiatives. Jackson talked about sustainability and revealed that 93 percent of Apple's facilities now run on renewable energy. The company also partnered with the WWF back in May 2015 to help protect forests in China that are used to make its product packaging, and it's working on a 1,300-acre solar farm to power its new headquarters.
rewritten_text:
The crimson sun bled into the silicon cityscape, casting an unholy glow upon the sprawling App Store. Ten days, a grotesque maw of greed, and Apple, the glutton, sucked the lifeblood from the Earth, draining its coffers to fund the insatiable hunger of its corporate maw.

From the smoldering depths of the App Store, a torrent of proceeds surged forth, each dollar a crimson coin, each cent a ravenous beast gnawing at the fabric of the planet. The World Wildlife Fund, a pale imitation of a benevolent creature, stood to be the unwitting pawn in this macabre game.

Angry Birds 2 and SimCity BuildIt, cameras that captured the horrors of the human soul, VSCO's seductive allure, and Line, the gilded cage of a thousand whispers, were but a few of the apps that spewed forth from the digital maw. Each one, a ravenous beast, clawing at the Earth's resources, leaving behind a trail of devastation.

The stench of desperation hung heavy in the air, a testament to Apple's insatiable hunger. The CEO, a grotesquely inflated ego, had become a ravenous beast, tearing at the fabric of the Earth with his avarice.

The WWF, a pathetic mockery of a protector, stood helpless as Apple's insatiable maw sucked the lifeblood from the planet, leaving behind a wasteland of broken ecosystems and poisoned air. The Earth, once a vibrant tapestry of life, lay stripped bare, a victim of Apple's callous disregard for the natural world.

original_text:
Donald Trump swept primaries in five Northeastern states on Tuesday, moving closer to winning the Republican presidential nomination as he easily defeated rivals Ted Cruz and John Kasich.

Trump scored victories in Pennsylvania, Maryland, Connecticut, Rhode Island and Delaware, US television networks projected. His margin of victory in each state appeared to be even larger than in his home state of New York a week ago, a major show of strength that sets the stage for a potentially pivotal battle next week in Indiana.

Democratic front-runner Hillary Clinton, already in control of the Democratic race, defeated challenger Bernie Sanders in Maryland, Delaware and Pennsylvania.

But in a surprise, Sanders was projected to have won Rhode Island. Connecticut's Democratic vote was too close to call.

Clinton, in a victory speech in Philadelphia, took aim at Trump for accusing her of trying to "play the woman card" in seeking to become the first female US president.

"Well if fighting for women's healthcare and paid family leave and equal pay is playing the woman card, then deal me in," she said to cheers.

Although the race remains fluid, Trump's wins made it less likely that Republicans would choose their nominee for the Nov. 8 presidential election at a contested convention in July in Cleveland, an outcome seen by Cruz and Kasich as their only chance at the nomination.

"They should drop out because frankly they have no path to victory," Trump told a Time interviewer at a magazine event in New York honoring influential Americans.

Cruz, already looking ahead to Indiana's Republican primary on May 3, addressed a crowd in that state just as polls were closing in the Northeastern states.

"I got good news for you: Tonight, this campaign moves back to more favorable terrain," the US senator from Texas said in Knightstown, Indiana, inside the high school gymnasium made famous by the underdog movie, "Hoosiers."

Appeal for unity

Clinton's strong showing in the Democratic race added to the pressure on Sanders to get out of the race or ease his criticism of her.

In her victory speech, Clinton gave a nod to Sanders and spoke of the need for party unity.

"Whether you support Senator Sanders or you support me, there is much more that unites us than divides us," she said.

Clinton reached out to a wide spectrum of voters, asking for support "if you are a Democrat, an independent or a thoughtful Republican."

The former secretary of state had an almost insurmountable lead of 275 pledged delegates heading into Tuesday's contests, and Senate Democratic leader Harry Reid told reporters he did not think Sanders, a US senator from Vermont, had a realistic path to winning the nomination.

Sanders, speaking to a big crowd in Huntington, West Virginia, showed no signs of getting out of the race and said he was shedding light on inconvenient truths about how hard life was these days for some Americans.

"The reason that we are generating this enthusiasm is because we are doing something very unusual in contemporary politics. We are telling the truth," he said.

A total of 118 pledged Republican delegates were at stake in addition to 54 unbound Pennsylvania delegates.

Cruz and Kasich, the Ohio governor, have formed an anti-Trump alliance in an effort to stop the New York billionaire from reaching a first-ballot victory at the July convention.

Former Republican presidential candidate Ben Carson, a Trump supporter, said the deal between Kasich and Cruz would backfire because it smacked of backroom politics.

In the sprawling metropolis of Philadelphia, the air hung thick with the stench of desperation. Hillary Clinton, a viper slithering through the undergrowth of the political jungle, delivered a venomous speech that echoed the hollowness of her own soul. Her voice, a siren's call to the disaffected masses, promised a cleansing firestorm, a purging of the corrupt cabal that had choked the life out of her party.

But the whispers of dissent were drowned out by the thunderous roar of Donald Trump's triumphant pronouncements. Pennsylvania, Maryland, Connecticut, Rhode Island, and Delaware - each state a crimson testament to his insatiable hunger for power.

The Democratic contenders, like withered flowers wilted by the scorching sun, offered tepid resistance, their voices drowned out by the deafening roar of Trump's triumphant pronouncements.

As the night wore on, the desolate plains of the Northeast transformed into a battlefield of blood and thunder. Trump, a gladiator with a hunger for blood, danced a macabre ballet of power, his every step a testament to his unyielding will.

The fate of the Republican nomination hung in the balance, a tinderbox poised to ignite into a conflagration. Cruz and Kasich, the vipers in the grass, were consumed by a singular desire - to extinguish the monstrous flame that threatened to engulf them.

The night belonged to Donald Trump, the prodigal son of the American nightmare, the harvester of souls, the reaper of hope. His victories were a symphony of despair, a chorus of the disenfranchised, a testament to the relentless march of the inexorable machine of ambition.

original_text:
Twitter wants to help you step up your livestreams.

The social network's livestreaming app Periscope is opening up its app so that users can live stream directly from cameras other than the ones on their smartphones. The effort, called Periscope Producer, is meant to help broaden the reach of live video on Twitter by making it more accessible to professional broadcasters.

At a basic level, Producer allows broadcasters to livestream to Periscope and Twitter directly from their own camera setup ‚Äî whether it's a laptop webcam or a professional-grade video camera. But it also opens up other features likely to appeal to pros, such as the ability for broadcasters to add custom animations, graphics and even advertising to their streams. (Periscope doesn't have these tools built-in, but Producer makes it possible for broadcasters to add these elements manually.)

The goal, says Periscope CEO Kayvon Beykpour, is to expand the type of live video content that's available on Periscope and Twitter.

We want to broaden what can go into the Periscope ecosystem

"We want to broaden what can go into the Periscope ecosystem," Beykpour said during a press event in San Francisco on Wednesday. "If it can be captured and distributed live through either software or hardware, we want it to be able to be piped into Periscope and Twitter."

Periscope has been testing the platform for the last six weeks with a small group of partners that's included media companies like ABC, Telemundo, Fox and CBS, as well companies like Disney and Louis Vuitton. Now, Twitter is ready to open Producer up to more people.

Organizations and individuals who are interested in using Producer can now sign up to be part of the platform.

Previously, Periscope had introduced a couple of hardware integrations, including the ability to broadcast from a GoPro and DJI drones. Unlike those one-off integrations, which required you to pair the Periscope app to your drone or action camera, getting set up for Periscope Producer is a little more involved.

getting set up for Periscope Producer is a little more involved

Producer requires broadcasters to use encoding software or hardware in order to link Periscope to the relevant camera feed. This is similar to how livestreaming on YouTube works, but it does mean that Producer is more likely to be used by brands, media companies and professional streamers than casual users.

Beykpour says he expects broadcasts created via Producer will be "an extremely small subset" of Periscope's daily broadcasts, most of which will continue to come from smartphones. But as Twitter continues to prioritize live video and events, enabling professional-grade live streaming could go a long way toward realizing its goals.

original_text:
Weekly Journal - It‚Äôs an arms race

Hello everyone!

As we approach summer, the team is becoming more and more aware of how much work we still have to do to ship this game, and our looming deadlines. It‚Äôs going to be a tumultuous few months, with us bringing on multiple new people (we‚Äôll explain that next week!) across all departments (except art) to help us improve the quality and scope of the game.

In general, the content for our next update is looking great (and is now done), and we‚Äôre finding that our AI overhaul has been very successful but needs more attention to get it ready for prime time. We‚Äôve also got some very exciting features coming in next week, which will dramatically change how the game is actually rendered. We might even get Guillaume (our CEO/creative director) to write about them! Watch this space next week. All this to say, we‚Äôre still looking good on late June/early July for the update, but we‚Äôll keep you updated as we lock down the AI.

Here‚Äôs what the team has been up to this week.

Programming

Michael

This week has been continuing to bounce between inventory makeover and fast travel.

We‚Äôve ended up redesigning our inventory redesign (hah) to try and reduce information overload, and give more space to show off each of the items in there.

It‚Äôs been fun trying to test the inventory stuff recently because a bug has caused the shopkeepers to be very aggressive. You really need to get in there and check that stuff is working before Stewart Adams starts trying to cleave you to pieces.

Clara

Unreal is fun. Unreal is fun. Unreal is fun. Repeat. (Clara makes Eric question his life choices.)

A lot of touch-ups on the UI design this week. I adjusted the animations for the toggles, played around with a still-ugly-but-about-to-get-better Error Box, finishing up the highlight animation for the quickslots‚Ä¶ slowly getting there.

Oh, also, the sleeping interface has changed a bit! This is going to give you much more feedback about what sleep will do for you. Looks disgusting for now, but we‚Äôre gonna clean that up eventually.

Chris

Hi all! Rob and I have joined the programming team this week and are excited to work on this game! We've been hard at work getting a UWP version of the game running for the Windows 10 store. We got Microsoft's branch of the Unreal engine with UWP support working on our machines and have brought over the changes into our version of the engine. There's still lots of work to be done, but it's been a productive week. Cheers!

Level Design

Antoine

Hello there ! Lots of work is being done on the story. I finished the blocking (rough event scripting pass) of the intro for our second character, and it‚Äôs looking really great! Very different from Arthur‚Äôs.

I also worked with Vincent and Michael to create feedback for the fast travel doors. When the player selects a location to travel to, Arthur will open the big metal door, walk down some steps and the screen will fade out. Arthur is basically using the maintenance corridors of Wellington Wells to travel from one shelter to the other.

Eric

Finally, I‚Äôm basically done with these underground jubilator shenanigans. Hope you guys like FX, explosions, and pressing buttons, ‚Äòcause there will be some of that in here. Plus corpse throwing. That‚Äôs always fun. (Like Unreal)

Animation Team

R√©mi

Hello! This week was a debugging week. I fixed multiple issues for the game encounters as well as some rigging tweaks and fixes. I also got to skin and integrate two more arm variants - Arthur finally has a wardrobe! I got to test the wonderful work that Matt has done to allow us to swap the arms in real-time when we equip different suits. Testing these out and seeing the switch in-game is amazing and adds a lot to the immersion/believability to the game.

Here‚Äôs a little something for you to enjoy it as well:

Have a good week!

Art Team

Carilitz

I got caught with some small tasks and fixing layout so I have not much to show but just one prop, made for the new shelter I'm working on! It's a little bit different from all the really creepy gory stuff I was making before but it was super fun to do it.

Marc-Andr√©

This week I finished tweaking last week's buildings. I fixed holes in the meshes and integrated them to the world spawner, so they now spawn in the Garden District. I also added a building with red bricks. In the next update, hopefully the Garden District will have more variety and feel more like a real place.

I also integrated multiple of Sarah's signs for the butcher's house as well as the pub, where a blueprint randomizer allows for different names and illustrations. I did a broken version of the Joy mask to be used in the TV Altar encounter. I did a butterfly net and foxglove flowers (before and after loot versions). I took multiple screenshots of our world with the new Joy. I fixed a few bugs. So basically, I did a lot of small things here and there!

Thanks for tuning in!

Compulsion Team

original_text:
MACOMB TOWNSHIP, Mich. - A murder warrant was obtained in a Macomb Township homicide and attempted suicide.

A woman was shot and killed by her husband while speaking to police dispatchers on the phone, police said.

You can listen to the 911 call in the video above.

Macomb Township police responded to a residence in the 1600 block of Country Ridge Lane in Macomb Township after a 38-year-old woman called police to report a domestic dispute.

While on the phone with dispatchers, several gunshots were heard over the phone.

When deputies arrived on scene, the woman and her 44-year-old husband were both lying on the floor with gunshot wounds.

Police said the woman was pronounced dead on scene and emergency crews transported the husband to a hospital with self-inflicted gunshot wounds.

Deputies located a .40 caliber hand gun on the floor near where the husband was lying.

Authorities said the husband is currently in custody at the hospital and his identity is being withheld pending warrant authorization and arraignment.

Police said the woman‚Äôs 16-year-old son was in the home at the time of the shooting and was uninjured .

He was turned over to family members.

Investigations into the incident are ongoing.

Stay with ClickOnDetroit and Local 4 news for updates on this story.

Sign up for ClickOnDetroit Email Newsletters (click here) for more stories like this.

Copyright 2016 by WDIV ClickOnDetroit - All rights reserved.

The chilling scene was captured on the city's CCTV cameras, a grim reminder of the dangers that lurked beneath the surface of this seemingly ordinary community. As the forensic team meticulously examined the scene, the residents of Macomb Township watched in shock and disbelief. The quiet town, known for its friendly residents and tight-knit community, had been plunged into a state of chaos.

original_text:
Catawissa, PA-based Bunge‚Äôs Meats recalled an undetermined amount of pork sausage products on Thursday that were produced with water that did not meet the Environmental Protection Agency‚Äôs (EPA) drinking water standards, according to the U.S. Department of Agriculture‚Äôs Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS). The various pork sausage items were produced between Feb. 24 and Sept. 15, 2016. Products subject to recall bear establishment number ‚ÄúEST. 21603‚Äù inside the USDA mark of inspection. These items were shipped to restaurants in Pennsylvania. The problem was discovered on Sept. 15 while an Enforcement, Investigations, and Analysis Officer (EIAO) was reviewing records during a Food Safety Assessment (FSA). The EIAO observed that results from the establishment‚Äôs third-party testing laboratory indicated that water samples collected at the establishment on Feb. 24 and Sept. 9 were positive for Coliform bacteria. The water is used in the formulation of the pork sausage products. There has not yet been any confirmed reports of adverse reactions due to consumption of these products. Anyone concerned about a reaction should contact a healthcare provider. Consumers who have purchased these products are urged not to consume them. They should be thrown away or returned to the place of purchase.

(To sign up for a free subscription to Food Safety News, click here.)
rewritten_text:

Bunge's Meats, a local staple, had just received a grim inspection report from the US Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS). The news painted a grim picture of their pork sausage products, produced between February 24 and September 15, 2016, being tainted with unsafe water.

The affected products, marked with establishment number "EST. 21603" on the USDA mark of inspection, were shipped to restaurants in Pennsylvania. The unsettling revelation sent shivers down the spines of locals, who had grown accustomed to the quality of Bunge's Meats' products.

As the community grappled with the gravity of the situation, a sense of helplessness permeated the air. The FDA's nonchalant dismissal of the potential health risks fueled a sense of anger and frustration. Many were left questioning the safety of their food supply and the government's ability to protect their health.

The town's once bustling streets were eerily quiet, with residents avoiding the area like the plague. The normally lively farmers' market remained deserted, the usual chatter replaced by hushed whispers and the sound of anxious phone calls.

The FDA's decision to leave the fate of the products in the hands of the restaurants, without any immediate intervention or recall, sparked outrage. Many demanded answers, demanding transparency from the authorities and a thorough investigation into the matter.

As the community grappled with the aftermath of this food safety nightmare, the question of trust hung heavy in the air. Former Expo Warren Cromartie is hoping to bring professional baseball back to Montreal in ‚Äúsome type of capacity‚Äù with a new company he is part of, The Montreal Baseball Project.

Cromartie was a speaker at the annual Cummings Jewish Centre for Seniors Sports Celebrity Breakfast on March 18.

‚ÄúComing into Montreal, I asked myself: You know, where can I go to see anything about the Expos?‚Äù Cromartie told the breakfast crowd. ‚ÄúAs you know, we have nothing in this town about the Expos ‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs like we never existed. That‚Äôs got to change. Baseball‚Äôs a part of this city.‚Äù

Cromartie will be back in Montreal on April 4 for a press conference to announce details about the The Montreal Baseball Project. He noted at the breakfast that five members of the 1981 Expos ‚Äì the only Expos team that advanced to the postseason and was one Blue Monday away from going to the World Series ‚Äì have died over the last year: Gary Carter, Charlie Lea, Woodie Fryman, John Milner and manager Dick Williams

‚ÄúWe have nowhere to recognize not only the ‚Äô81 team, but the ‚Äô94 team and the very first team since 1969,‚Äù Cromartie said. ‚ÄúI have taken it upon myself with my new-found company, The Montreal Baseball Project. We are committed to bring baseball in some type of capacity back here in Montreal.‚Äù

(Gazette file photo)

original_text:
U.S. President George W. Bush declares an end to major combat in Iraq during a speech to crew aboard the aircraft carrier USS Abraham Lincoln as the carrier steamed toward San Diego, California, in this May 1, 2003 file photo.

As America hurtles toward a potential Bush-versus-Clinton dynastic rematch, no Democratic loyalists have yet come forward to insist that Bill Clinton was in fact speaking the truth when he denied having sexual relations with that woman. There is, however, a continual submerged effort to deny that George W. Bush‚Äôs administration misled the country into the Iraq War. Today, The Wall Street Journal op-ed page has Republican judge Laurence Silberman fiercely insisting that the Bush administration did not lie, and that the claim it lied is itself a calumny.

Silberman‚Äôs argument is a simplistic one aimed at confusing those who have already forgotten the basic sequence of events. Silberman argues that a bipartisan commission, which he co-chaired, investigated the matter, and found that the Bush administration was victimized by faulty intelligence. ‚ÄúOur WMD commission ultimately determined that the intelligence community was ‚Äòdead wrong‚Äô about Saddam‚Äôs weapons,‚Äù concludes Silberman. So, yes, mistakes happen, but intelligence failures happen, and the Bush administration cannot be blamed for dishonesty.

Silberman does not mention that the commission he chaired did not even investigate whether the Bush administration manipulated intelligence. Senate Republicans refused to allow the commission to investigate this matter, fearing it would harm Bush‚Äôs reelection prospects. Indeed, Silberman himself wrote in the report at the time, ‚ÄúOur executive order did not direct us to deal with the use of intelligence by policymakers, and all of us were agreed that that was not part of our inquiry.‚Äù

This was a favorite line of pro-Bush spin. It is true that passing on faulty intelligence by mistake is not the same thing as misrepresenting intelligence. Bush‚Äôs defenders habitually rebutted accusations of the latter by insisting that the former was true. In reality, both things happened ‚Äî the administration suffered from honest intelligence failures, and it misled the public about the facts as it understood them.

The question of whether, in addition to being victimized by faulty intelligence, also misrepresented the intelligence it did have, was left to a second Senate report, called the ‚ÄúPhase II‚Äù report, which came out a few years later. That report, which was endorsed by two of the committee‚Äôs seven Republicans and all its Democrats, concluded, ‚Äúthe Administration repeatedly presented intelligence as fact when in reality it was unsubstantiated, contradicted, or even non-existent.‚Äù

Incredibly, Silberman‚Äôs op-ed does not mention the Phase II report at all. Silberman simply asserts that his committee, which was specifically instructed not to investigate whether Bush manipulated intelligence, did not find that Bush manipulated intelligence, and presents this as the final word.

It is hard to believe that Silberman expects such a crude exercise in propaganda to actually succeed. His intention appears to be slightly more indirect: to turn the demonstrable fact that the Bush administration deliberately misled the public into, at the very least, a partisan dispute that journalists cannot repeat without fear of being accused of bias. Silberman shrewdly selects as his target Ron Fournier, the apotheosis of the journalistic ethos that the truth lies halfway between the competing claims of the two parties at any given moment.

Silberman uses the occasion of Fournier repeating the fact that Bush lied about Iraq as a fact to admonish him for bias. ‚ÄúIn recent weeks, I have heard former Associated Press reporter Ron Fournier on Fox News twice asserting, quite offhandedly, that President George W. Bush ‚Äúlied us into war in Iraq,‚Äù Silberman writes, ‚ÄúIt is astonishing to see the ‚ÄòBush lied‚Äô allegation evolve from antiwar slogan to journalistic fact.‚Äù Silberman‚Äôs goal here seems to be to make it impossible for journalists to treat this particular fact as if it were a fact.

He argues that the Bush administration's actions cannot be excused because they were not the result of honest mistakes, but rather deliberate deception.

**The media plays a crucial role in shaping public perception:** Silberman highlights the difference between the bipartisan commission's initial findings and the subsequent Phase II report, which concluded that the administration misrepresented intelligence. **The truth is often a matter of perspective:** While Silberman focuses on the lack of bipartisan agreement and the media's role in shaping public perception, it is important to remember that there are different perspectives on the same events. Some people may argue that the intelligence failures were not as significant as some have claimed, or that the media's coverage was biased.

**The line between truth and propaganda is often blurred:** Silberman's argument suggests that the line between truth and propaganda is often blurred when it comes to political discourse. He argues that the "Bush lied" claim has been used by both sides to achieve their own political goals, and that the media's repeated coverage has helped to normalize this distortion of reality.

**The legacy of this parallel universe is complex:** The events of this parallel universe raise important questions about the role of truth in politics and the media. Covert gun concealers fancying a little James Bond-like action can head over to online auction site Gunbroker to nab a piece of spy history in the way of the Heckler & Koch Operational Briefcase.

Fabricated out of hard polymer and aluminum, the case measures 20 by 15-by-15 inches. Though the particular briefcase up for grabs does not come with a firearm, this unique piece of gear is equipped with mounting brackets to immediately accept the HK MP5K or the SP89, according to the listing.

Shooters familiar with the MP5K know its the shortened version of the HK‚Äôs MP5. Weighing in at just 5.5 pounds and with an overall length of 12.8 inches long, the MP5K nestles inside the briefcase with ease. Boasting an integrated trigger into the briefcase handle, the MP5K inside the case can churn out rounds at 900 rpm ‚Äî emptying a 15 to 30 round magazine in one to two seconds.

Its sister, the SP89, is the semi-automatic pistol variant of the MP5 designed for civilian sporting use.

Touting use by elite special forces around the globe, the HK Operational Briefcase gives operators a discreet means to carry.

While carrying a briefcase gun will make owners feel like James Bond, the device‚Äôs practicality is up for debate. Off body nature of carry makes it susceptible for stealing in close quarters combat scenarios. The guns will be difficult to aim given that users cannot sight them properly due to encapsulation in the briefcase. Also, once the MP5K or SP89 have been emptied, the briefcase makes for awkward and time consuming reloads.

This particular briefcase auction does not require a tax stamp from the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives nor does it require FFL transfer since it does not actually come with a gun. Winning bidders that happen to already own a MP5K or SP89 should be aware that dropping either gun into the briefcase moves it into ‚ÄúAny Other Weapon‚Äù territory under the National Firearms Act and thus necessitates that ATF tax stamp. For further clarification on what is and is not accepted under the NFA, contacting a local ATF representative is recommended.

Bidders will have until Dec. 7 to nab this HK Operational Briefcase, courtesy of Midwest Tactical and Gunbroker.com. Current bid at the time of this writing was at $3,225.

The classic platform title Bonk‚Äôs Adventure is set to make a return with the game recently rated by the ESRB for the Wii U Virtual Console.

Starring a strong and bald cave boy who goes on an adventure to rescue a princess, the charming title developed by Red Company and Atlus was originally released on the Turbografx-16 system in Japan in 1989. It was later re-released in the US in 1992, and from there was ported to several systems including the NES and Game Boy.

The title has since appeared on the GameCube as part of a special collection, and received a digital revival in 2006 when it was released on the Wii Virtual Console under the Turbografx-16 banner.

original_text:
While most of us are familiar with the standard lunch and/or smoke break, there‚Äôs an entirely other ‚Äì much kinder, more satisfying ‚Äì pause to the day that people in workplaces around the world have apparently been taking.

According to recent polls conducted by Time Out New York and Glamour, respectively, 39 per cent of men revealed that they masturbate at work, while 31 per cent of women said they, too, take to self-pleasure in the workplace ‚Äì and these are just the people willing to admit it.

It‚Äôs tough pulling off a standard 9-5, or any daily work routine, without resorting to an intermission here or there. We take lunch breaks to sustain ourselves, we take bathroom breaks to relieve ourselves, and we daydream throughout the day just to break up the monotony of sitting in the same place, week after week.

But sometimes, talking about the weather between cubicles with your co-worker just doesn‚Äôt cut it. Swapping Game of Thrones spoilers by the water cooler isn‚Äôt satisfying enough. And chatting with the office gossip between bathroom stalls leaves something to be desired.

Everything feels better and looks clearer after a little bit of self-love

Sure, it‚Äôs an awkward subject, even between the closest of friends, but it‚Äôs a universal pastime almost as necessary as, say, drinking water and breathing. And it might even just improve your performance.

‚ÄúI would expect a masturbation policy to result in more focus, less aggression, higher productivity and more smiling,‚Äù psychologist Cliff Arnall said to Metro U.K. this week. ‚ÄúCertainly, taking a masturbation break for boredom or an escape would increase work focus.‚Äù

Missed your train? Struggling to make a client happy? Finding it difficult to locate a source for a story? Spilled coffee on your files this morning? There are few ways to better rid yourself of stress. Everything feels better and looks clearer after a little bit of self-love.

Besides, if smoke breaks are so common and cigarettes are essentially killing you softly, why not have a healthier (and possibly more cathartic) option on hand? Bonus points for those who can go to town in the same amount of time it takes to squeeze in a quick smoke.

After all, if you‚Äôre willing to go as far as pleasuring yourself in the dingy confines of an off-colour, sterile bathroom next to the faulty stall while your co-workers potentially linger about outside, you surely are in desperate need of a break.

But just remember that while there is potential for hand-to-gland combat in the workplace, it will forever remain something not to be shared with your co-worker ‚Äî don‚Äôt ask, don‚Äôt tell.

Next to a fenced-in urban garden and down from the Insite safe injection site, half a dozen young men stood around, smoking and handling skateboards outside two bright red doors. Inside, 12 skaters dropped into a 45-foot-long ramp build into the narrow brick hall.

article continues below

The SBC Restaurant ‚Äî an indoor skate park at the former Smilin‚Äô Buddha Cabaret ‚Äî is the only one of its kind in Vancouver since opening at 109 East Hastings Dec. 1. A hand-printed sign on the door reads ‚Äúeveryone‚Äôs welcome‚Äù and the address is sprayed on the door in black paint.

‚ÄúWe anticipate that there‚Äôs going to be a lot of people who are going to want to skate at this place,‚Äù said Andrew Turner, one of three founders and owners of the SBC.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve had about 100 people skating around in the three days that we‚Äôve had it opened. And the ramp can handle about 20 people at a time max, so it‚Äôs been operating at close to capacity for most of the time that it‚Äôs been open.‚Äù

Parks board chairperson Sarah Blyth, who got her political start organizing the Vancouver Skateboard Coalition, said SBC is a welcome addition, especially as the temperature drops and wet winter weather sets in.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve needed one for a very long time,‚Äù she said, noting one of the early goals of the coalition was to create an indoor park. Leeside, a sheltered tunnel near Hastings Park, is a popular destination but it‚Äôs not heated.

SBC runs in two-hour sessions from 3 to 5 p.m., 5 to 7 p.m. and 7 to 9 p.m. Each session costs $10.

Famed in the 1950s as the Smilin‚Äô Buddha Dine & Dance, the venue became a cabaret favoured by seasonal labourers (it hosted ‚Äúgirlie‚Äù shows and served cheap bar liquor) and then emerged as a destination for psychedelic and experimental rock as well as the underground punk and hardcore scenes in the ‚Äô70s and ‚Äô80s. Jefferson Airplane, Jimi Hendrix, 54-40 and DOA all played the Smilin‚Äô Buddha.

This week, the Heritage Vancouver Foundation recognized the Smilin‚Äô Buddha, ‚Äúthe destination for edgy music in Vancouver,‚Äù for helping shape the city‚Äôs identity and named it a place that matters. Its famous neon sign of a reclining, large-bellied Buddha sitting beside a steaming hot pot, is in the permanent collection of the Museum of Vancouver.

A skate park is a natural reincarnation for the neighbourhood cabaret, said Bev Davies, a photographer who arrived in Vancouver in 1968 and became a talented, blonde fixture in the city‚Äôs music scene.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs part of that same underground culture,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúIt maintains its street cred. Culturally, it‚Äôs the same anti-establishment culture that punk rock was part of. Did I say was? I mean is.‚Äù

The hall today is a long corridor of painted brick, sparse lighting, stenciled posters and graffiti. A large poster of the illustrious namesake neon sign hangs on the wall. The children of the late cabaret owners, Nancy and Lachlan Jir, are divided in their support of the reincarnation of the Buddha title. Two of their daughters were expected at the SBC on Wednesday for a Vancouver Heritage presentation. A ‚Äúplace that matters‚Äù plaque will be installed at a later date.

The space was forgotten as a derelict dump until it was revived. Turner, his brother Justin and Malcolm Hassin approached city officials nearly three years before signing the lease.

‚ÄúWe wanted to make sure it was going to go over,‚Äù said Turner. ‚ÄúWe didn‚Äôt want them to be alarmed or surprised that we were here.‚Äù

The centrepiece of the SBC, the six-foot ramp with pool coping and a seven-foot wall ride scales down to three feet to accommodate different skill levels. The ramp is actually a hybrid creation from other dismantled parks, including, Turner said, ‚Äúparts of the Richmond skate ranch, Expo 86 ramp, Kevin Harris‚Äôs ramp, Malcolm‚Äôs little back yard ramp‚Ä¶

‚ÄúWe built everything. It‚Äôs recycled, salvaged materials because we did it with no money.‚Äù

There‚Äôs also pieces of the ‚Äúcrack pipe,‚Äù a Powell Street ramp built indoors by the folks at the Antisocial skateboard shop.

‚ÄúSo there‚Äôs like six or seven different ramps that went into making this place, which is pretty cool,‚Äù Turner said.

The SBC can also host live music.

In the heart of Vancouver's vibrant East Hastings neighbourhood, a magical fox named Finley emerged from the shadows, his bushy tail swishing back and forth. He had heard the children's laughter echoing through the streets and decided to join their joyful dance.

As the sun began its descent, casting long shadows across the cobblestone streets, Finley approached the children, his eyes twinkling with mischief. He introduced himself in a voice as soft as the wind chimes that hung from the nearby buildings.

"Greetings, young ones," Finley said. "I am Finley, the magical fox of this neighbourhood. I have heard your laughter and music, and I am here to spread a little magic of my own."

The children gasped in awe. They had never seen a talking fox before. Finley explained that he could grant their wishes, but he needed their permission first.

"What would you like, children?" Finley asked.

The children, brimming with excitement, asked Finley to help them build a magical garden in the middle of the park. Finley, with his magical touch, transformed the barren patch into a vibrant oasis. Flowers bloomed in vibrant colours, butterflies danced among the flowers, and a small pond shimmered in the sunlight.

As the children played and laughed, Finley watched with a smile on his face. He knew that his magic had touched them deeply, and he was grateful for the opportunity to share it with them.

With the sun setting, Finley bid the children farewell, promising to return soon. He disappeared into the shadows, leaving the children with a sense of wonder and magic.

And so, the children of East Hastings, under the twinkling lights of the city, continued their joyful play, knowing that they had a magical guardian watching over them.

original_text:
The planet is hot and getting hotter. But while most plans to use geoengineering to alter the weather have been rather hypothetical, now a pair of Harvard engineers have announced that they intend to spray thousands of tons of particles into the sky to block the sun's rays‚Äîwithin the coming year.

Advertisement

The pair plan to launch a balloon to ascend 80,000 feet over Fort Sumner, New Mexico, before pumping out tens or hundreds of kilograms of sulphate aerosols into the sky. The idea is that the particles will reflect sunlight back into space, helping decrease the temperature of the Earth.

In theory, they're replicating the effects they've observed as volcanoes spew out similar sulphates into the atmosphere. In practice... well, there is no practice, because nobody's ever done it before. David Keith, one of the scientists, explained to the Guardian:

"The objective is not to alter the climate, but simply to probe the processes at a micro scale. The direct risk is very small."

Advertisement

Yeah, right. But however confidently he says that, in reality he doesn't know. It's hardly surprising, then, that the plan has its fair share of opposition, from scientists who believe that the experiment could have unpredictable‚Äîand therefore quite possibly negative‚Äîeffects. Still, that doesn't seem to bother Keith or his partner James Anderson too much. In fact, they're keen to push forward with the project and plan to put it into action within the next twelve months.

In truth, it's difficult to decide if the idea is a good one or not. It's easy to speculate about how effective geoengineering projects can be without ever actually putting one into action. So in that sense, it's good to see someone bite the bullet and give it a try‚Äîhere's hoping it works out. [The Guardian]

Image by davedehetre under Creative Commons license
rewritten_text:
In the shimmering heat of the planet, under a sky ablaze with a million stars, lived a curious child named Lily. Her laughter echoed through the shimmering streets, a melody that brought life to the bustling city. But one night, as Lily lay dreaming, a different sound filled her ears‚Äîa rustling in the bushes, a soft chuckle that sent shivers down her spine.

"Who's there?" Lily asked, her eyes wide with wonder.

The chuckle echoed again, closer this time, and a voice spoke, soft and raspy, "Lily, my child, why the curious gaze?"

Lily's heart skipped a beat. She sat up straight, her eyes wide with fear and excitement. The voice introduced itself as Zephyr, a talking fox with a heart as warm as the sun.

"I have come to be your friend, Lily," Zephyr said, his voice like the rustling leaves in the wind. "I have heard your laughter from afar, and I am drawn to your curiosity."

Lily, still trembling, sat up straight and introduced herself. She told Zephyr about her life, her dreams, and her love for the planet. Zephyr listened intently, his eyes twinkling with curiosity.

"I am a creature of the night, Lily," he said, his voice echoing with a soft wisdom. "I have seen the world change, the seasons come and go, and the weather dance to the rhythm of the moon. But I have also seen the beauty of the Earth, the kindness of her people, and the power of her spirit."

Zephyr shared stories of his adventures, tales of ancient forests, hidden waterfalls, and creatures that roamed the night. Lily, in turn, told him about her life in the city, her love for books and music, and her dreams of becoming a scientist.

As the night wore on, the bond between Lily and Zephyr grew. They shared stories, dreams, and secrets under the starry sky. Lily learned about the magic of the night, the secrets of the forest, and the interconnectedness of all living things.

Zephyr, in turn, learned about the world through Lily's eyes. He showed her the wonders of the night sky, the twinkling stars, and the dancing patterns of the clouds.

As the sun rose each morning, Lily and Zephyr would sit on the rooftop, watching the world wake up. Lily would tell him about her day, and Zephyr would share stories of his adventures.

And so, under the scorching sun, a magical bond was forged between a child and a talking fox, a friendship that would light up the night and warm the hearts of all who knew them.

original_text:
AUSTIN, Texas ‚Äì Texas lawmakers have passed legislation requiring doctors to perform a sonogram before conducting an abortion.

The legislation requires doctors to conduct a sonogram at least 24 hours before an abortion and to provide the woman with the opportunity to see the results and hear the fetal heartbeat. The doctor is also required to describe what the sonogram shows.

In cases of incest, rape or fetal abnormality, the woman doesn't have to hear a description of the fetus.

Texas Governor Rick Perry, a Republican, stands behind the controversial measure. While different versions of the proposal were under debate earlier this year, Perry regarded the legislation as an emergency priority.

"Ensuring Texans have access to all the information when making such an important decision is a critical step in our efforts to protect life, and I look forward to this legislation reaching my desk very soon," said Perry in a statement earlier this week, lauding the state legislature for advancing the measure.

Proponents say the law is necessary to make sure women understand what an abortion entails. Opponents say it would interfere in the doctor-patient relationship.

‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs very demeaning to women and I think we have more important things to do like balance the budget without hurting families and make sure we can fully fund education and healthcare and take care of things that are important to our economy and not political partisan issues such as a sonogram bill I thought it was a very intrusive example of big government,‚Äù said State Rep. Carol Alvarado, according to My Fox Houston.

The Lone Star State outlet relays a statement issued by NARAL Pro-Choice Texas, a non-profit state-wide organization, on the legislation:

"Patrick consistently fails to publicly mention the hardship that the 24-waiting period between the sonogram and abortion will cause for those who live in the 93% of Texas counties that don't have an abortion provider. Indeed, this bill is designed to shame women, as if we are daft creatures unable to make personal, private medical decisions without the paternalistic oversight of legislators.‚Äù

The Legislature passed the measure on Thursday. It now awaits the governor's signature.

English for Scammers

Rated 5.00 / 5 based on 4 reviews

Curious why no one has claimed their UK lotto winnings from you? Why no one wants to call about the box of cash valued at (7,500,000 Dollars)? Why no one is responding to your PASSIONATE REQUEST FOR JOINT MUTUAL INVESTMENTS BENEFITS? This textbook analyzes common mistakes, drawn from genuine correspondence, and helps you improve your writing to be appropriate for standard business correspondence. More

Curious as to why no one has claimed their UK lotto winnings from you? Why no one wants to call about the box of cash valued at Seven million five hundred thousand Dollars US (7,500,000.00 Dollars)? Why no one is responding to your PASSIONATE REQUEST FOR JOINT MUTUAL INVESTMENTS BENEFITS? If so, this book is for you.

Every day, it seems, we get heart-breaking emails like this one:

"I see know reasons why you are been so skeptical about your bank draft presently in our custody."

We can tell you why. It‚Äôs your English. Your English is ‚Ä¶ bad. Inaccurate. Ungrammatical. Inappropriate.

While this book is not written for scammers, its purpose is to help you avoid writing like a scammer and having your business letter wind up in someone‚Äôs junk mail folder.

No one wants that. What you want is to have your business letters read and acted upon ‚Äì because you‚Äôre in business.

"English for Scammers" analyzes common mistakes, drawn from genuine correspondence, and tells you how to improve your writing so that it is appropriate for standard business letters written in English.

Topics include:

* Proper forms of address

* Openings and closings

* Spelling

* Punctuation and capitalization

* HOW MANY CAPITAL LETTERS ARE TOO MANY

* Basic grammatical constructions

* Common sentence patterns for business letters

* When it is advisable to refer to your esophageal cancer; your religious faith; your charitable intentions; your connections with the UN, plane crash victims, and dead lottery winners; and more

* Appropriate tone and register

Use "English for Scammers" to hone your 419 letters ‚Äì or even to write honest, clear, direct business correspondence.

The choice, dear readers, is yours.

The book also includes a section on how to handle common mistakes in English grammar and punctuation. This information can be helpful for anyone who is learning English, or for anyone who wants to improve their writing skills.

Overall, the book provides valuable insights into the art of writing effective business letters. By following the advice in the book, individuals can improve their communication skills and increase their chances of success in the business world.

When was the last time you visited your local sanitation garage for a gallery tour? Over the course of 33 years, sanitation worker Nelson Molina has collected thousands of items that can tell stories about NYC and its people arguably better than any hallowed institution could. His carefully curated collection titled ‚ÄúThe Treasures in the Trash Museum‚Äù has its home in a sanitation garage on the Upper East Side. Though it‚Äôs not normally open to the public, you can get access during Open House New York weekend. Check out this article for more photos.

original_text:
Plane Captains: Last Eyes to Ensure Mission Ready

By Mass Communication Specialist 3rd Class Paolo Bayas

CORAL SEA (NNS) -- Plane captains attached to squadrons aboard the U.S. Navy's forward-deployed aircraft carrier USS George Washington (CVN 73) are responsible to ensure that every aircraft is mission-ready.

Plane captains assigned to line divisions perform maintenance and daily checks on every aircraft.

"Plane captains are usually the most junior personnel in the squadron," said Chief Aviation Structural Mechanic (Equipment) Richard Brickey, line division leading chief petty officer from the "Dambusters" of Strike Fighter Squadron (VFA) 195. "However, we teach them that we trust them with a pilot's life and an 80-million dollar aircraft, which requires them to be the most responsible."

According to Chief Aviation Machinist's Mate Sunsuke Ueeda, line division leading chief petty officer from the "Saberhawks" of Helicopter Maritime Strike Squadron (HSM) 77, the plane captain qualification is the first major responsibility that airmen earn upon arrival to a squadron.

"I came to be a plane captain knowing nothing," said Airman Miles McGowan, plane captain assigned to VFA 195. "My responsibility was to learn everything in the syllabus and earn all of the qualifications necessary to become a plane captain. I stay on my toes, remain professional and ensure that I do not overlook anything because the smallest thing can kill someone."

Aviation Structural Mechanic 3rd Class Katrina Franklin, a crew lead plane captain assigned to VFA-195 says, responsibilities of a plane captain includes daily, pre-flight and post-flight checks. These checks include; cockpit for foreign object damage hazards; cockpit switchology; straps are fastened; emergency oxygen is at proper levels; auxiliary power unit circuit breakers are at 3,000 pounds per square inch; canopy is absolutely clean; intake blades are clean; and no cracks and no missing fasteners.

"As soon as we get on the flight deck, we begin to double-check our previous night check to ensure the aircraft is mission-ready," said Franklin. "On top of that, we practice and compete with one another on how good our hand-signals are executed. Performing hand-signals is the most enjoyable part of our job."

Two hours before a flight, plane captains conduct another check to ensure that fixed-wing aircraft can perform an internal built-in test; a full-throw check that consists of testing the flight surface controls and the trim, a setting in the aircraft for launching from an aircraft carrier.

For helicopters, plane captains check the engines, gear boxes, hydraulic pumps and corrosion.

"Our helicopters shake themselves apart because that is in their nature," said Aviation Electrician's Mate Airman Brian Silveira, a plane captain assigned to of HSM 77. "As plane captains, we ensure that the aircraft is in good working order. We are the last set of eyes before our aircraft is cleared for flight and our aircrew gets in there and goes up. So it's a big responsibility to ensure that our aircraft does not fall out of the sky and end up losing lives."

It takes about six months to become a plane captain. It is a designation separate from each individual's rate.

"It is a very rewarding job," said McGowan. "I have my name on the side of a multi-million dollar aircraft. But what we instill within each other and our new incoming personnel, who will be our replacement, is safety comes first."

George Washington and its embarked air wing, Carrier Air Wing 5, provide a combat-ready force that protects and defends the collective maritime interest of the U.S. and its allies and partners in the Indo-Asia-Pacific region.

For more news from USS George Washington (CVN 73), visit www.navy.mil/local/cvn73/.

The world of physics in this world is different, and events unfold accordingly. Plane captains, stationed aboard the U.S. Navy's forward-deployed aircraft carrier USS George Washington (CVN 73), are responsible for ensuring that every aircraft is mission-ready.

* Cockpit checks for foreign objects
* Cockpit switchology
* Straps fastened and emergency oxygen levels checked
* Auxiliary power unit circuit breakers checked
* Canopy inspected for cleanliness
* Intake blades inspected for cracks and missing fasteners
* Engines, gear boxes, and hydraulic pumps inspected for functionality
* Helicopters' engines, gear boxes, and hydraulic pumps inspected for functionality

**Qualifications for a Plane Captain:**

* Must be the most junior personnel in the squadron
* Must be responsible and trustworthy
* Must be highly skilled and experienced in aircraft maintenance
* Must be able to handle the weight and responsibility of a multi-million dollar aircraft

**The Importance of Plane Captains:**

Plane captains are the last set of eyes before an aircraft takes off, ensuring that it is safe for flight. Their responsibility is to ensure that the aircraft is ready to fly and that the aircrew is properly trained and equipped to operate it.

**The Rigorous Training Process:**

Becoming a plane captain takes approximately six months. It is a rigorous training program that covers a wide range of topics, including aircraft mechanics, safety procedures, and emergency procedures.

**The Rewards of Being a Plane Captain:**

Plane captains are highly respected and have a sense of pride in their work. They are responsible for the safety of the crew and passengers, and they are proud to be part of the team that protects the U.S. Navy and its allies.

original_text:
Alabama state Rep. Ralph Howard was arrested Sunday in Greensboro for allegedly using a shotgun to shoot out two tires of his wife's car, according to the Sumter County Record-Journal.

Greensboro Police Chief Mike Hamilton told the Record-Journal that Howard, D-Greensboro, was arrested without incident, and spent one night in the Hale County Jail before making bond.

He is charged with domestic violence, reckless endangerment, and harassment, the paper said.

A call to the Montgomery office number listed on Howard's Alabama Legislature website went unanswered; his district phone number repeatedly gave a busy signal.

This is not Howard's first run in with the law.

In 1999, Howard was charged with assault in the second degree after allegedly shooting a man in the thigh. The case was dismissed after the complainant did not appear in court.

In 2013, Howard was charged with DUI, and reportedly had a blood alcohol level of .24.

The following year, he was cited for driving while his license was revoked, with an expired tag, and without insurance. Those charges were dismissed.

According the Alabama Legislature's website, Howard was elected to the Alabama House in a 2005 special election. His district, House District 72, covers parts of many Black Belt counties including Perry County, Marengo County, Hale County, Bibb County, Greene County, and Sumter County.

From Bulbapedia, the community-driven Pok√©mon encyclopedia.

Misty's Duel (Japanese: „Ç´„Çπ„Éü„ÅÆÂãùË≤† Kasumi's Game) is a Trainer card. It was first released as part of the Gym Heroes expansion.

Card text

All prints You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck. Team Plasma Team Plasma You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck. FLARE You can't have more than 1 card with the same name in your deck. If a card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead. {{{ruletext}}} You and your opponent play a game of Rock-Paper-Scissors. The winner shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws a new hand of 5 cards. (If you don't know how to play Rock-Paper-Scissors, flip a coin to decide who's the winner.) Do Nothing At the beginning of your turn, flip a coin. If heads, you can do nothing during your turn. If tails, your opponent can do nothing during his or her next turn.

Release information

In Japan, this card was released in the Hanada City Gym Theme Deck. It was later released in the Gym Heroes expansion, having been previously reprinted in the Japanese Leaders' Stadium expansion.

Trivia

The mechanic of playing rock‚Äìpaper‚Äìscissors has only been seen three other times in the TCG; Team Galactic's Wager from the Mysterious Treasures expansion, First Ticket from the Japanese Dragon Selection subset, and Xatu from the Legendary Treasures expansion. It was not included in the English print of First Ticket.

original_text:
A quick peek at Google's self-driving koala car

07-11-2015

Today Google had an open house where they showed off their self-driving koala car. The event was really more of an info session for Paint the Town, a contest they're running for local artists to submit artwork that will be featured on the sides of the car. We weren't allowed inside (includes arms through the windows), but here are some of the pics I could get, followed by some observations.

Observations

It has often been stated that the car prototype has a steering wheel and pedals to comply with California and federal law. That's a bit of a stretch. It has a box with a giant kill switch on it, a crank and the kinds of buttons/controls you would see on a gamepad. I couldn't get a picture of this, unfortunately, since I wasn't allowed to put my camera inside the car.

The car has sensors all over: front, rear, side mirrors and on the top. Inside the car, two LCDs on the side show what side mirrors would usually show.

The dome on the top is not a spinning Velodyne like the Lexus fleet, but something else that serves the same purpose.

There's an antenna in the back that looks like a standard wireless router antenna. Could be for V2V communication.

The outside is very soft, but also very strong. I guess there's some sort of foam layer on top of aluminium.

It's bigger than you would think, and all that space goes into the interior. It's very spacious in there.

Everyone in attendance seemed very excited, and one person even emphasized he was looking forward to the day that we would have some sort of Uber app, but with SDCs that come pick you up and drop you off. Google has already hinted at this idea on their website and in videos, so it seems like people out here agree with their idea.

Google had a sign up saying photos were encouraged and should be posted under #selfdrivingcar, so after the break are some photos posted on Instagram.

My photos and content are all CC-By. Feel free to copy them, mirror them, use them elsewhere, draw little arrows on them, etc., so long as you cite my name or username or link to this page, or otherwise ask for permission.

Hosting an event for Google's new #selfdrivingcar today. Verdict? It's cute. üòä A photo posted by Sharon Kenney (@sekenney) on Jul 11, 2015 at 3:58pm PDT

#selfdrivingcar A photo posted by D. Schmidt (@mind_detonator) on Jul 11, 2015 at 3:31pm PDT

The car, resembling a giant koala with a box-shaped kill switch and a crank-operated mechanism, exuded a sense of mystery. The sensors lining the car's perimeter, including front, rear, side mirrors, and atop, hinted at a sophisticated AI at work.

The soft, yet robust exterior was surprisingly spacious, with an interior that offered ample room for passengers. The two LCDs on the side displayed information reminiscent of a car's display, but with a distinct futuristic flair.

A towering antenna in the back, resembling a wireless router antenna, hinted at V2V communication capabilities. The exterior, surprisingly, was composed of a lightweight material that resembled foam layered atop a sturdy aluminum frame.

The crowd buzzed with excitement, with many eagerly awaiting the unveiling of Google's self-driving koala car. An Uber-like app, with SDCs for pick-up and drop-off, was also mentioned, sparking a collective "yes" from the attendees.

Social media erupted with photos and videos, with hashtags like #selfdrivingcar trending across platforms. My own contribution, captured by Sharon Kenney (@sekenney), showcased the car's whimsical design and the vibrant Paint the Town contest.

The verdict? The Google self-driving koala car is a delightful and futuristic marvel, a testament to the boundless potential of technology to transform our world.
